availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Kerr (Monroe County, Kentucky, student and soldier in the 37th KY)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Kerr and Emily Kerr. Resident in Monroe County, Kentucky, in 1850. Student in Monroe County in 1860. Served in Company K 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from November 6, 1863, to April 8, 1864. Served in Company K 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Corporal from April 8, 1864 to February 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 393B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 3.
Applications for Headstones for U.S. Military Veterans, 1925-1941, NARA RG 92, Records of the Office of the Quartermaster General.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 418.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 381.
